text: heads up <@U2670DYLE> I added some details to the todo list yesterday/today.  Can ya update the todo list based on progress before stand up so we can talk immediate next 2-3 things?
sure, I will take a look

<!here|@here> some notes based on our stand up today:
- <@U0HP6TFNX>  is diving into the CMS at 12.  My biggest cocern remains: parity with data model and it’s ability to store/retrieve content.
- <@U02F9CXTL> will have the “key (Pant Size Chart) of four layouts soon.  I suggesst we link to them from the home screen.  
- <@U02E3CRMA> are you doing the proof point one sheet or is that still with John?

A few other deadlines folks requested clarity around? 
- Tuesday: sending CMS to client for socialization and dogfood.  Needs ot be functional but ok if there are lingering refinements.  
- Tuesday: <@U0HP6TFNX>  to present CMS to Content Partners 
- Tuesday: Display Designs sent to client/ready for Dev (will roll in any client comments we accept) 
(It’d be great to send a snap of the Podium as well if we feel confident in it) 
- Thursday AM: Begin Podium dev so wires need to be finalized

<@U02F9CXTL|jstrand> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/jstrand/F42BED3CP/screen_shot_2017-02-06_at_11.45.21_am.png|@dennishanley @johncohoon @justin @megan> and commented: these will repeat for the other 3 - let me know any thoughts before i continue -

initial_comment.comment: these will repeat for the other 3 - let me know any thoughts before i continue -

text: I think the fidelity is right.  Watch for spelling of Initiative.  I have to defer to <@U0HP6TFNX> to ensure that the logic/biz requirements of templates are right.
I think these work. I'll be happy to do a QA pass on logic once we settle on final wall layouts
cool good to know <@U0HP6TFNX> for now just looking to ensure that the right contents correspond with the layouts.  I could use a sanity check there but what I’m seeing looks right
looks right to me so far, will make sure it still does when the dust settles on all the design work in progress
makes good sense and appreciated thus far
hey <@U0EL0GLEL> hows it going with auth?
pretty close
cool, once done will you need to deploy?
yeah
cool, i’m hopeful to see it in the 3:30.  let us know if not possible.
<@U0EL0GLEL> and <@U02F9CXTL> what do ya say we get latest display designs printed and also on our rig in library?  4pm- EOD?

you want the latest design on the rig? im not ready for that, fudging it like playtest would require more work, the api changed some since then and I have to tie the display into those changes yet. going to do that next. And I havent even tried deploying anything to the rig yet.
roger that.  what about displaying designs in browser instances on there?  was thinking its a low fi way of doing so, maybe thats what you mean by Playtesting?

if you just want the images displayed on each screen you could prop it up that way, if you have the image files and just open the images and position them manually on each screen. would need either each screen by itself or one large image to display across them. either would take some fanagling to set them up on the machine.
easiest would be one huge image, throw it up on the storage bucket, open chrome to it, and hit full screen
it should display across them right if the image is sized right

<@U02E3CRMA> I defer to you here.  Feels like if it takes any effort at all, than it should be funneled towards updating APi and getting it on Rig the right way.  <@U0EL0GLEL> if you had final designs tomorrow EOD, how long until we could see them on the rig?

havent seen them not sure what the effort is. I have a few updates to do on the api and display. then i assume there is some css work to match up the designs to the display output. a few days i would imagine
ok i’d like to place a goal of friday (dependent upon the design).  <@U02F9CXTL> can share out progress today as we’re sending to client tomorrow.

Auth is working, im running a deploy now, it will be up in a min. it will auth against the person’s google account. And there is a list of email addresses that are valid for access in the system, they will be able to manage this through /admin/users this route is not published in the admin. We will just tell whoever needs it that it is there. They can add a name and email address on that page. and that will grant access to the admin
<@U0EL0GLEL> once the deploy is done hit me with direct link.  i think I’m grok'ing
<@U0EL0GLEL> will you shoot me a link too when ready?
I'm assuming I'm getting a 403 Forbidden | nginx error because the deploy is in process, but flagging it in case that's not expected
yeah just a sec, i had an issue with the deploy, its deploying again
with that in mind <!here|@here> 15 min warning before 3:30 review.  lets ensure latest changes are reflected.
<@U0EL0GLEL> now getting a 502 server error
yes i know
working on it
kk
<!here|@here> we are blocked on review til deploy clears up.  <@U0EL0GLEL> to give signal when done and we’ll meet at John’s desk
having a merge conflict should clear up in a sec
<!here|@here> still standing by
deploy running

<!here|@here> we missed the entire time slot.  will need to pick this up at 4:30 and a result some work may spill into the evening.  To help mitigate, please help contextualize the progress that we’ll be reviewing.
its deploying it just takes a while
tested it locally it was all fine reflecting everything pushed so far
good to hear though I dont have a clear model of whats pushed so far.  See ya at 4:30 at John’s Desk
I only added auth for the admin, John will have to weigh in on the pushed progress

I pushed updates for the logic pertaining media items. IE switching back and forth between video/embed/image. image upload/cropping is implemented across all screens(although still need to plug in aspect ratio and size constraints.  Also i added a confirmation to deletion. Completed but not pushed is flash messaging to indicate content has been saved.
<!here|@here> alright, we're deployed. heading to Glass to get set up for our 4:30
thank you <@U02E3CRMA>
we will be ther ein 5
:alarm_clock:
lol i hear ya. coming
<@U0HP6TFNX> <@U0260V4K1> we are in glass
spotted this <http://spec.commonmark.org/> there appears to be a library for angular to support it too. looks like a decent markdown
<http://hypercubed.github.io/angular-commonmark/#/api>

attachments.title: Docs
attachments.text: AngularJS is what HTML would have been, had it been designed for building web-apps. Declarative templates with data-binding, MVC, dependency injection and great testability story all implemented with pure client-side JavaScript!

text:
<@U2670DYLE> Wall Content Templates:
<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0BzY5boFyNkdiRWJUQXFoZ3hKVnM?usp=sharing>

<!here|@here> plan as it relates to CMS:
- Deploy occruing right now.  Dev team to let us know when done so I can verify Peter’s fixes and Megan can do her UX pass
- <@U0HP6TFNX> to do UX pass
- <@U2670DYLE> to ping us via slack when we’re ready to review his progress tonight.

GOAL: be presentation ready tonight.

We have until 11m tomorrow for contingency deploys

I’m communicating to client that we are still on to train tomorrow.

<!here|@here> plan for Design:
- Jason updating slide deck right now.  Ping Justin and I when done.  
- <@U0260V4K1> to review and redline, esp with context for what content triggers which layout (will be re-purposed on Home page of CMS)
- Justin to present to client at 11am

I’m sending client agenda for meeting tomorrow
Deploy done?
had an issue and redeploying
im back online
The app is deployed. ignore the error msg for now
ok i will test in 10 min.  <@U0HP6TFNX> you are good to hit the link as well!
i'll get rid of that error and redeploy
Ok, does that mean we are ready for final review or is there work in progress?

<@U0ML49XU0> <@U0HP6TFNX> <@U0260V4K1> Just need to add flank comps - 
<https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1IKZHgPrShriCb1LYDwSsbp5nwvS61c16xqiTP21AjtM/edit?usp=sharing>
Going to walk louie for 15 min
<@U0HP6TFNX> we talkd about two reviews tonight: this one is the one where you can go in and note the field names etc
peter mentioned that his auth issues were changed so i’ll verify those.  we’re doing another sweep after john completes his list and does another deploy
K, will jump on the first review
i’m in there too

as joel would say “we’re cooking with gas” - I just crossed out Peter’s tasks that I verified.  Joel has verified as well.  <@U2670DYLE> and <@U02E3CRMA> please tag me in comments on the tasks you complete in next deploy.   I’ll cross out to confirm and then I’ll move them to the completed section tomorrow.
<@U02F9CXTL> i’m turning my attention to your stuff right now
<@U0ML49XU0> Im back
louie is happy
not really but - its cool
wassssup louie

<@U02F9CXTL> and <@U0260V4K1> I’m done reviewing design stuff.  Looks good.  Essentially looking for Justinto redline and add context for presentation.  
- <@U0260V4K1> you cool to present this to Allie at 11 and keep the team casting small? If we want Jason there (we always want Jason there) we’ll kick hi out after preso.  
- <@U02F9CXTL> you cool to take 10 min to print out and review the design with dev team tomorrow?
<@U0ML49XU0> YES! Would love too.
cool, thats 2:30!  I want to look at that, CMS and get DEV working on your designs and the accompanying rules ASAP
Just finishing dinner and then I'll dive into the doc
<@U0HP6TFNX> i verified some fixes.  did you get to do the UX pass for field names, Initiatives or Tags for launch?
in progress
:metal-hair:
<@U0ML49XU0> <@U2670DYLE> done with a field name pass, all added to google doc
awesome i’ll :eyes: now
looks good <@U0HP6TFNX> how about initiatives?
I included the feedback I had on field names in initiatives
I was going to hold off on QA observations (duplicate fields in initiatives) until we get the go ahead for the QA pass
did you see anything else missing?
i’d list the duplicative fields now.  otherwise, you’re good.
in parallel <@U2670DYLE> how you doing?
Are the duplicate fields in initiatives the images? I switched it to Image and then Thumbnail Image
<@U0ML49XU0> I'm cranking through some of these updates. I'm running a deploy now. it's slower to deploy with node to gae. :disappointed:
<@U2670DYLE> yes, there were duplicate image / url fields in the initiative screen
<@U2670DYLE> can you comment or paste here what I can expect to verify in the deploy?
one sec.
kk

Field names
Left hand nav: use plural labels
initiatives
stories
tags
locations
partners
users (ok as is)
Initiatives
Change “thumbnail image” to “image”
Stories: indicate optional fields with a parenthetical in field title
call to action title (optional)
call to action URL (optional)
wall body copy (optional)
initiative (optional)
partner organizations (optional)
Stories
Initiative: default text says “please sele” instead of “Please Select”

Just rolling with video and images on story details
Remove other options
Published/Non-Published should be a binary radio button with default being unpublished.
Error states: field validation existence check
Success messages (Y)

Home screen: let’s include layout template chart or some language explaining that documentation will eventually housed here.  Dennis to provide 

		“Welcome

“Here’s how stories will be displayed in the exhibit

[Layout templates:<https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/document/d/1iEMlu0EDQZiv1OIc7twRuPFzKKQaMpBtaY4bp0dHan4/edit?usp=sharing>]
Under Google Logo type project name: “Google Net Contributor App CMS”
alright, alright, alright i’l test with this as son as you give the signal that deploy is done!
<@U2670DYLE> i see some of the fixes took and am reconicling the sheet now.  gimmie 5
<@U2670DYLE> looks like a strong build!
there is another one going up now.
<@U2670DYLE> i reconciled list based on last build.  Can we level up and clear up what can be done for tonight?
<@U0ML49XU0> sorry. i was debugging something there. I'm pushing up a build with the pants descriptions. I'm looking at the todo now.
cool cool.  Joel is gonna give me hooks to see deploy completions BTW so i dont have to bug ya.
lets just set goal for tonight and tes tthe stability so we can branch any further feedback til after review
hoping there's some kind of deploy hook that we can get to at least email folks
hmmm, havnt seen any but seems like there should be
<!channel> Headed for nightmares - if you need anything from me - please text - <tel:503-410-6856|503-410-6856>
peter.bliss: right!? massive oversight if not
im not seeing anything so far... but there might be a way to roll your own
there is a setup function called during the node deploy i think, you might be able to drop some kinda script in there that fires off an email
hmm there is the start script, could call something there. but that would call everytime the app.js was fired, which would be on deploy as well as if there was an error and needed to start again
I was holding my QA type feedback for final review, but just to make them available in case they're helpful for late night/early morning work, I've added them to our CMS to do doc
perfect!

<!here|@here> HUGE day.  Thanks to John, Megan, Joel, Jason, Justin (in no particularl order) for going all the extra miles!  

We have a CMS to review with Content Partners at 1.  
- John’s going to make final changes and update the sheet tomorrow.  *His final deploy is 10am.*  
- Biggesst priority that I see is the Save Story flow.  Joel can help explain in person as I’m in meetings tomorrow.  

We have Designs to share with the client at 11!

Accordingly, with all this progress across Design and Dev, I’m trying to re-purpose our Stand Up time to be a Show and Tell.  It’s a bit last minute so it’s possible this moves but I’d like to make it happen. Following this meeting, I have a full plan for all workstreams for tomorrow that I’ll share.

Gnight

big day
